Class MTTriangleMesh

java.lang.Object

All Implemented Interfaces:
IMTComponent, IMTComponent3D, IMTInputEventListener, ILassoable, IGestureEventListener
Direct Known Subclasses:
MTCube, MTSphere
public class MTTriangleMesh
extends AbstractShape

A mesh class for drawing triangle meshes.

Author:
Christopher Ruff

Constructor Detail

MTTriangleMesh

public MTTriangleMesh(processing.core.PApplet pApplet,
                      GeometryInfo geometryInfo)
Creates a new triangle mesh.

Important: This mesh expects triangles geometry!

  • An unindexed geometry's vertex array should contain pairs of three vertices.
  • An indexed geometry should contain pairs of three indices.

    Parameters:
    pApplet - the applet
    geometryInfo - the geometry info

    • MTTriangleMesh

    public MTTriangleMesh(processing.core.PApplet pApplet,
                      GeometryInfo geometryInfo,
                      boolean calculateDefaultNormals)
    Creates a new triangle mesh.

    Important: This mesh expects triangles geometry!

  • An unindexed geometry's vertex array should contain pairs of three vertices.
  • An indexed geometry should contain pairs of three indices.

    Parameters:
    pApplet - the applet
    geometryInfo - the geometry info
    calculateDefaultNormals - sets if default normals for lightning should be calculated if the geometry doesent containe them yet - WE ARE ONLY REQUIRED TO CALCULATE NORMALS IF THE MESH IS TO BE USED WITH LIGHTNING!
    • Method Detail

    setGeometryInfo

    public void setGeometryInfo(GeometryInfo geometryInfo)
    Description copied from class: AbstractShape
    Sets a new geometryInfo with new vertices for this shape.
    If running in OpenGL mode, this also creates new vertex buffers for openGL use and eventually new Vertex Buffer Objects or Displaylists depending on the objects settings! So DONT create them (buffers or vbos) on the geometryinfo yourself manually, prior to setting it here!
    Also calls computeDefaultBounds() if setAutoComputeBounds() is true (default) to recreate the bounding shape.
    NOTE: Be aware, that an old geometryinfo of this shape may have created VBOs or displaylists on the gfx card which we should delete if not needed anywhere else!

    Overrides:
    setGeometryInfo in class AbstractShape
    Parameters:
    geometryInfo - the geometry info

    setVertices

    public void setVertices(Vertex[] vertices)
    Description copied from class: AbstractShape
    Sets new vertices for that shape. and generates new vertex arrays for opengl mode.
  • Re-computes and sets the shapes default bounding shape.

    Overrides:
    setVertices in class AbstractShape
    Parameters:
    vertices - the vertices

    • isCalculateDefaultNormals

    public boolean isCalculateDefaultNormals()
    Checks if default normals should be calculated if a new geometryInfo or new vertices are set on this mesh.

    Returns:
    true, if is creates the default normals

    setCalculateDefaultNormals

    public void setCalculateDefaultNormals(boolean calculateDefaultNormals)
    Sets if default normals should be calculated if a new geometryInfo or new vertices are set on this mesh.

    Parameters:
    calculateDefaultNormals - the new creates the default normals

    calculateDefaultNormals

    public void calculateDefaultNormals()
    Calculates default normals for this mesh if the mesh's geometryInfo doesent yet contain normals. Creates face or vertex normals -
    Face normals if the geometry isnt indexed and Vertex normals are created if the geometry IS indexed.

    getCenterPointLocal

    public Vector3D getCenterPointLocal()
    Description copied from class: AbstractShape
    Gets the center point in local object space. This should always return a COPY of the centerpoint of the implementing shape since the point may get transformed afterwards.

    Specified by:
    getCenterPointLocal in class AbstractShape
    Returns:
    the center point of this shape in untransformed local object coordinates.

    isGeometryContainsPointLocal

    public boolean isGeometryContainsPointLocal(Vector3D testPoint)
    Description copied from class: AbstractShape

    Specified by:
    isGeometryContainsPointLocal in class AbstractShape
    Parameters:
    testPoint - the test point
    Returns:
    true, if checks if is geometry contains point

    public Vector3D getGeometryIntersectionLocal(Ray ray)
    Description copied from class: AbstractShape

    Specified by:

    Parameters:

    Returns:
    the geometry intersection the intersection point or null if no intersection occured

    drawComponent

    public void drawComponent(processing.core.PGraphics g)
    Description copied from class: MTComponent
    Executes this component's drawing commands (Not its children!). The component's matrix has to be made current before drawing.
    This method can be overridden in subclasses and filled with drawing commands.
    NOTE: This method is called by the application. Usually you should not invoke this method directly!

    Specified by:
    drawComponent in interface IMTComponent
    Specified by:
    drawComponent in class AbstractVisibleComponent
    Parameters:
    g - the graphics context

    setOutlineContours

    public void setOutlineContours(java.util.List<Vertex[]> contours)
    Sets the outline contours.
    NOTE: To draw the outlines, the default setting of noStroke has to be changed to false!

    Parameters:
    contours - the new outline contours

    generateDisplayLists

    public void generateDisplayLists()
    Description copied from class: AbstractShape
    Generates 2 openGL display lists for drawing this shape.
    One for the interior (with textures etc.) and one for drawing the outline.
    setUseDirectGL has to be set to true first!
    To use the display lists for drawing, call setUseDisplayList() This method only generates them!
    NOTE: if the shape was using a display list before we should delete it before setting a new one!

    Overrides:
    generateDisplayLists in class AbstractShape
